|wi2_if_name = |rad2chip1 = Broadcom;BCM43217;BCM43217KMLG, HD1547 P10, 552347-46 1 W; |rad2oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad2_ant_conn = <!-- Leave blank for unknown --> |rad2txchains = 2 |rad2rxchains = 2 |rad2sstreams = 2 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |nqam2 = <!-- 600, 800, 900, 1000, --> |rad2n = 300 |rad2g = 54 |rad2b = 11 |rad2freq = 2.4 |rad2correv = <!-- core revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |rad2cap = <!-- radio capabilities, Leave blank for none or unknown -->
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "10024325 V1.4" is silkscreened on the board in the photos.
* Web GUI: http://tendawifi.com
===Disassembly=== * Remove two philips screws in the back. * Remove the stand, if attached. You'll need to apply pressure :to the inner two clips to get them to unlatch; do so with a :screwdriver inserted through holes in bottom of foot. * You'll then need a set of spudgers or other thin/stiff plastic :to pry the two halves of the case apart. I broke about half the :clips opening mine, but the screws and remaining clips are :enough to hold the case together.
==Links of Interest== ===Reviews=== *[https://www.digitalcitizen.life/review-tenda-ac9-ac1200 ''Tenda AC9 AC1200 review'' on '''Digital Citizen''']
==JTAG-Serial Info== ===Serial=== ====Serial Pinouts==== 3.3V (115200, 8N1) - labeled J1. See PCB pic below.
{| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" | 1 | 2 | 3 | 4 |- | +3.3V | Tx | Rx | GND |}
{{/Serial info}}
